Still, a name already exists and you're gonna make a new one..
like..

Use it for yourself if you want or not

"struggle" I didn't have any issues with them.
Honestly, I still like Floppies over CDs simply because they, like flash drives, you just plug them in and they work. You can write / rewrite, copy remove, any individual anything
lol
floppies are very versatile, though they're very small
CDs are not
We used floppy's one year in school because we had to type up our projects and not everyoe had a computer or typewritter. The floppys was so you could save your work without having it tamperd with.
flash drives really are the successor floppies
Or the connecting to internet by phone line. Having to disconnect because mom or dad wanted to use the phone
when I went to school, literally noone had computers in my classes.
everyone wrote by hand
*blink* What internet? I did not have the internet. You think everyone had the internet?
we had the net back when my family moved to GA back in 1990 cuz my dad was in the navy,
had two phone lines installed into the house
one for the network, one for the phone
lucky you
hm, luck really nothing to do with it
yeah I had a type writer... r-r kinda miss those things. Love the sound they made

The "rich" kids had computers. I had the school computer lab (I think the computers were from the 80's) and a typewritter. I remember my class being so exited when we finally got our computer upgrade in '98...I think it was
it was the 1998 yeah. They got cheaper so schools starting teaching kids how to use the computers
lol, I remember having my own computer back in 94, 95.. ish. Don't remember when I first got it though.
My school had a crap budget
granted by the time we moved from GA, we had a debt of some ridiculous amount
cuz the business my dad had died out
yknow, I would trade the benefits I had of my youth for my parents to not have torn apart
no amount of stuff will make you happy
Dang.... Don't know how that compares to being a welfare kid
My parents are still together...despitte everything they have been through
even if you're on welfare, or in the poor house, etc, you can still be happy, and have a supportive family
Yeah, exept we were not happy
but all the toys in the world wouldn't fix the shipwreck that was my family when I was a kid :/
somethin I learned the hard way
..... My parents separated and my dad died a month after I got back from Afghanistan in Dec 2011
SO yeah... not fun
